alert.note: Alert for South Central Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kane County through 630 PM MST... At 544 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Kanab, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Kane County. This includes US Route 89 between mile markers 25 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
